Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
The Player class represents a player in the game. It stores the player's name, position, alive status, and skin (representation). The class implements Serializable to allow saving and loading player data.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • name

      public String name
      The player's name.

    • x

      public int x
      The horizontal position of the player on the game grid.

    • y

      public int y
      The vertical position of the player on the game grid.

    • isalive

      public boolean isalive
      The player's alive status. If true, the player is alive; if false, the player is dead.

    • skin

      public String skin
      The player's skin (visual representation in the game).

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name)
      Constructs a new Player with the given name. Initializes the player's name and sets the initial values for the position and alive status.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.
